title: Compiler bug: type parameter `T/#0` (T/0) out of range when substituting

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ``` unsafe fn f(ptr: *mut T, new: *mut u8) -> *mut T { use std::mem; let mut parts: [*mut u8; mem::size_of::<*mut T>() / mem::size_of::<*mut u8>()] = mem::transmute(ptr); parts[0] = new; mem::transmute(parts) } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.42.0-nightly (13db6501c 2020-02-01) binary: rustc commit-hash: 13db6501c7273cd1997ce20e15106f362e5613c4 commit-date: 2020-02-01 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.42.0-nightly LLVM version: 9.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: src\librustc\ty\subst.rs:565: type parameter `T/#0` (T/0) out of range when substituting (root type=Some(fn() -> usize {std::mem::size_of::<*mut T>})) substs=[] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', <::std::macros::panic macros>:2:4 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.42.0-nightly (13db6501c 2020-02-01) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: aborting due to previous error ```
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: src\librustc\ty\subst.rs:565: type parameter `T/#0` (T/0) out of range when substituting (root type=Some(fn() -> usize {std::mem::size_of::<*mut T>})) substs=[] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', <::std::macros::panic macros>:2:4 stack backtrace: 0: ::fmt 1: core::fmt::write 2: ::fmt 3: std::panicking::take_hook 4: std::panicking::take_hook 5: rustc_driver::report_ice 6: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook 7: rustc::ty::structural_impls::::lift_to_tcx 8: rustc::ich::impls_hir:: for rustc_attr::builtin::InlineAttr>::hash_stable 9: rustc::util::bug::bug_fmt 15: ::fold_ty 16: rustc::ty::structural_impls::::lift_to_tcx 17: ::fold_ty 18: rustc::ty::error::::prefix_string 19: rustc::ty::structural_impls::::lift_to_tcx 20: ::fold_ty panic: #0 [const_eval_raw] const-evaluating `f::{{constant}}#0` #1 [const_eval_validated] const-evaluating + checking `f::{{constant}}#0` #2 [const_eval_validated] const-evaluating + checking `f::{{constant}}#0` #3 [typeck_tables_of] processing `f` #4 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #5 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error ```
